intro: Elionurus candidus, commonly known as the white sand grass, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale blue florets that are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
